intro: Gynodon cernuum, commonly known as the drooping gynodon, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its slender, often branching stems. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the Apiaceae family. Its leaves are narrow and alternate, often with a slight hairy texture. Gynodon cernuum is typically found in moist, sandy soils and is often associated with open woodlands and disturbed areas.
